title: SupplyMobile (MAUI): AdHoc Order > First submitted order does not appear immediately until user re-navigates in Order List after Force Sync
acceptanceCriteria:
The first submitted AdHoc Order should appear immediately in the Order List after submission.

If not immediate, performing Force Sync on the Order List should be enough to refresh and display the new order.

User should not be required to leave and re-enter the Order List screen just to see the new order.
description:
Issue: First submitted order does not appear immediately until user re-navigates in Order List after Force Sync
Environment: PROD/QA

acceptanceCriteria: Current Quantity should correctly update to Previous Qty - Reclaim Qty immediately after Reclaim confirmation. title: SupplyMobile (MAUI): Order > Remaining Qty for Second Order Not Updating Immediately after Refill; this happens when same Product Exists in Multiple Orders
acceptanceCriteria:
After refilling an ordered product via Stock page or skipping order selection :
The Remaining Qty in the Order page should update immediately. No manual or auto-sync required to reflect changes. Qty Values should remain consistent between Stock and Order modules. Should Apply to both ESL-linked and non-ESL ordered products. Should Work across single-location and multi-location products.
description:
When the same product exists in two different orders, the handheld device fails to immediately update the remaining quantity for the second order after performing a refill (either through Pocket Refill or Order Refill (skipping order selection).

title: SupplyMobile > Recompile app with 16 KB native library alignment
acceptanceCriteria: When requirements are delivered
description:
Purpose:
Ensure our Android build aligns bundled native libraries on 16 KB boundaries so the app is compatible with newer devices, improves memory-mapped loading performance, and clears the Google Play Recompile your app with 16 KB native library alignment recommendation.

Risk & Impact:

If fixed: Compatible with newer
devices, better native load performance, Play technical-quality warning
cleared.
If unfixed: Potential install/run issues
on future devices with 16 KB page size; ongoing Play warnings that may
affect distribution and user trust.

Scope of Work:
update to the latest toolchain that supports 16 KB alignment in packaging.

Additional Notes:

Devnotes:

What Changed:

What Was Impacted:

What Must Be Tested:

title: SupplyMobile (MAUI): When a product is loaded to a single location, transacting from the Location list triggers an incorrect modal prompting the user to transact in another location
acceptanceCriteria:
Actual Result:
A confirmation modal appears prompting the user to transact in another location, even though the product is loaded in only one location.

Expected Result:
The confirmation modal should not appear for single-location products. After the transaction, the app should proceed normally (e.g., return to Product list or Location list based on workflow) without suggesting another location.
description:
Description: When a product is loaded to only one location , performing a transaction from the Location List incorrectly displays a confirmation modal that asks the user if they want to transact in another location. This behavior is incorrect because the product does not have multiple loaded locations.

Pls. see video

Risk/Impact:

Medium  Causes confusion and suggests a wrong workflow. May mislead users into assuming additional locations exist.

Additional Info:

Devnotes:

What Was Impacted:

What Must Be Tested:

title: SupplyMobile (MAUI): Search Storeroom > Search field does not auto-focus after tapping search icon
acceptanceCriteria:
When the user taps the Search icon in the Search Storeroom screen:

The search text field should automatically receive focus .

The cursor should be visible inside the field, and the on-screen keyboard should appear so the user can start typing immediately.

No additional tap should be required to focus the search field.

Please see attached video for Xamarin behavior
description:
Issue: Search field does not auto-focus after tapping search icon

Environment: PROD
